subject: AI & Agents
title: API-First: Using AI Provider APIs
description: A quick win: understand API-First: Using AI Provider APIs.

hook.text: One API call to OpenAI and your product has AI. No GPU, no training, no infra.

buildup.text: AI APIs (OpenAI, Anthropic, Google) let you add intelligence with minimal engineering.

discovery.text: Benefits: instant start, no ML expertise needed, automatic improvements from the provider.

twist.text: Risks: vendor lock-in, pricing changes, rate limits, and dependence on external uptime.

climax.text: Abstract the AI provider behind an interface. Switch providers without rewriting your product.

punchline.text: Start with APIs. Migrate if you outgrow them.

quiz.question: What is the main risk of using AI provider APIs?
options: Vendor lock-in and dependence on external services
